column1: # Legend: POR = default value; WTD = watchdog; R/W = read/write; R = read-only
column2: OTP-configurable = the register’s default value can be configured via the OTP

column7: Comment

column6: Resets the register. 0: Keep the current setting 1: Reset the registers to their default values
column7: This bit returns to 0 after it is written to 1.

column6: 0: The STAT/IB pin is configured as an open-drain status indicator (STAT) 1: The STAT/IB pin is configured as a battery current indicator (IB)
column7: OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: The PG/NTC2 pin is configured as an open-drain power good indicator (PG) 1: The PG/NTC2 pin is configured as a second thermistor input (NTC2)
column7: To enable the NTC2 channel this bit must be set to 1. OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Not locked 1: The VBATT[5:0] ICC[5:0] IPRE[3:0] JEITA_VSET[1:0] and JEITA_ISET[1:0] values are locked
column7: After this bit is set to 1 any future writes to VBATT[5:0] ICC[5:0] IPRE[3:0] JEITA_VSET[1:0] and JEITA_ISET[1:0] can only reduce the set values.

column6: 0: Disable the hold-off timer 1: Enable the hold-off timer
column7: OTP-configurable.
Configures both the buck and boost operating frequencies. Default: 1MHz (01) OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: VIN_LIM is fixed 1: VIN_LIM also tracks VBATT
column7: When this bit is set to 0 the VIN_LIM register sets the absolute input voltage limit (VIN_LIM) value. When this bit is set to 1 VIN_LIM is the maximum value between VIN_LIM[3:0] and (VBATT + 165mV).

column6: 000: Follow the IIN_LIM setting 001: Force IIN_LIM to 100mA 010: Force IIN_LIM to 500mA 011: Force IIN_LIM to 900mA 100: Force IIN_LIM to 1500mA 101: Force IIN_LIM to 2000mA 110: Force IIN_LIM to 3000mA
column7: When setting these bits to 000 the input current limit (IIN_LIM) follows the automatically generated IIN_LIM value in IIN_LIM[4:0]. When setting these bits to other values IIN_LIM is fixed. Default: 000 OTP-configurable.
Sets IIN_LIM. Range: 100mA to 3.2A Offset:100mA Default: 500mA (00100) This is automatically updated after input source type detection. The host can overwrite the IIN_LIM value.
Sets the pre-charge to fast charge battery voltage threshold. Default: 3V (11)
Sets the fast charge current. Default: 2A (011001) OTP-configurable.
Sets the pre-charge current Range: 80mA to 680mA Offset: 80mA Default: 240mA (0100) OTP-configurable.
Sets the termination current. Range: 30mA to 480mA Offset: 30mA Default: 120mA (0011) OTP-configurable.
Sets the recharge threshold. Default: 100mV
Sets the trickle charge current. Range: 32mA to 256mA Offset: 32mA Default: 128mA (011) OTP-configurable.
Input voltage limit threshold Range: 3.88V to 5.08V Offset:3.88V Default:4.36V (0110)
Timer to stop charging after charge termination.
Sets the battery regulation voltage (VBATT_REG). Values above 101000 (4.6V) are clamped to 101000. Range: 3.6V to 4.6V Offset: 3.6V Default: 4.2V (011000) OTP-configurable.
Sets the input over-voltage protection (OVP) threshold. Default: 6.3V (00) OTP-configurable.
Sets the system minimum regulation voltage (VSYS_MIN).Default: 3.588V (100) The actual system regulation voltage is this value plus VTRACK=150mV OTP-configurable.
Sets the thermal regulation threshold for charge mode as well as the thermal protection threshold for boost mode. Default: 100°C (100)

column6: 0: IB outputs when the switcher is on 1: IB outputs all the time
column7: Enables IB when only the battery is present which uses about 3µA of battery current. Default: 0
After writing this bit to 1 the watchdog timer is reset and this bit returns to 0.
Default: 40s (01) OTP-configurable.
Default: Enable termination (1)
Default: Enable 2x timer (1)

column6: 00: Disable timer 01: 5hrs 10: 10hrs 11: 15hrs Sets the charge safety timer.
column7: Default: 10hrs (10)

column6: 0: Allow BATTFET to remain on 1: Turn off BATTFET
column7: Shipping mode or OCP

column6: 0: Turn off BATTFET immediately 1: Turn off BATTFET after a 10s delay
column7: Sets the delay after BATTFET_DIS is set to 1. Default: Turn off BATTFET after a 10s delay (1)

column6: 0: Disable the BATTFET reset function 1: Enable BATTFET reset function
column7: Default: Enable the BATTFET reset function (1)
Sets the boost output current limit. Default: 3A (11)
Sets the boost output voltage. Default: 5.15V (111) OTP-configurable.

column6: 000: Sink only 001: Source only 010: DRP 011: DRP with Try.SNK 100: DRP with Try.SRC 101: Disabled
column7: When the mode changes the device resets to Unattached.SNK. Default: Sink only (000) OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: On-the-go (OTG) mode is controlled by the host 1: OTG is automatically controlled by CC detection
column7: Default: 1 OTP-configurable.

When AUTOOTG = 1 the EN_BOOST bit is set/reset automatically and boost mode is enabled/disabled. Writing 0 to EN_BOOST also turns off boost mode. When AUTOOTG = 0 the host can determine the boost requirement with the OTG_NEED bit. Writing 0 to EN_BOOST disables boost mode; writing 1 to EN_BOOST enables boost mode.
Set this bit to 0 to force the buck converter off.
Set this bit to 0 to force charging off.

column6: 0: D+/D- detection starts manually 1: D+/D- detection automatically starts after VIN_GD = 1 and the hold-off timer ends
column7: Default: 1 OTP-configurable.
This bit returns to 0 after 1 written

column6: 00: 80μA default USB 01: 180μA USB Type-C 1.5A 10: 330μA USB Type-C 3A
column7: Sets the current rating advertisement in boost mode. Default: 01 OTP-configurable.

column6: 00: The CC1 and CC2 pins are automatically configured via CC_CFG 01: Forces the CC1 and CC2 pins to Rd 10: Forces the CC1 and CC2 pins to Rp (set by RP_CFG) 11: Forces the CC1 and CC2 pins into a high-impedance (HiZ) state
column7: Default: 00 OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Disables high-voltage adapter detection 1: Enables high-voltage adapter detection
column7: Default: 1 OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: DP and DM do not change 1: DP = DM = 3.3V for 500μs
column7: HVUP is only functional when DPDM_STAT = 1001 and HVREQ[1:0] = 11. This bit returns to 0 after being written to 1.

column6: 0: DP DM unchanged 1: DP = DM = 0.6V for 500μs
column7: HVDOWN is only functional when DPDM_STAT = 1001 and HVREQ[1:0] = 11. This bit returns to 0 after being written to 1.
HVREQ is only functional when DPDM_STAT = 1001. This bit is reset to 00 once VIN_GD = 0.

column6: 0: Only generate INT when the NTC1 status changes 1: NTC1 is fully functional
column7: The buck converter is not affected by this bit. Default: 1 OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Only generate INT when the NTC2 status changes 1: NTC2 is fully functional
column7: The buck converter is not affected by this bit. Default: 0 OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Battery OVP is neglected 1: Battery OVP is enabled
column7: Default: 1
If VBATT drops below BATT_LOW an INT pulse is generated with a 10ms debounce time. Default: 3V (00)

column6: 0: The BATT_LOW comparator only generates INT 1: The BATT_LOW comparator turns off boost operation and latches
column7: Default: 0 OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Boost OTP is ignored 1: Boost OTP occurs at TREG
column7: Default: 1 OTP-configurable.

column6: 00: No action during an NTC warm condition 01: Reduce VBATT_REG during an NTC warm condition 10: Reduce ICC during an NTC warm condition 11: Reduce both VBATT_REG and ICC during an NTC warm condition
column7: If both the NTC1_ACTION and NTC2_ACTION bits are set to 1 see Table 6 on page 21 for more details. Default: 01

column6: 00: No action during an NTC cool condition 01: Reduce VBATT_REG during an NTC cool condition 10: Reduce ICC during an NTC cool condition 11: Reduce both VBATT_REG and ICC during an NTC cool condition
column7: If both the NTC1_ACTION and NTC2_ACTION bits are set to 1 see Table 6 on page 21 for more details. Default: 10
Default: 00

column6: 00: 50% of ICC 01: 33% of ICC 10: 20% of ICC
column7: Default: 00
Sets the hot falling threshold as a percentage of VVRNTC. Default: 23% (10)
Sets the warm falling threshold as a percentage of VVRNTC. Default: 32.6% (01)
Sets the cool rising threshold as a percentage of VVRNTC. Default: 64.8% (10)
Sets the cold rising threshold as a percentage of VVRNTC. Default: 74.2% (01)

column6: 0: Normal 1: Source current to the IN pin
column7: Enables the input impedance test.
Configures the input impedance test current source.
Configures the input impedance test comparator threshold.

column6: 0: Enable the THERM_STAT INT pulse 1: Mask the THERM_STAT INT pulse
column7: OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Enable the VINDPM and IINDPM INT pulses 1: Mask the VINDPM and IINDPM INT pulses
0: Enable the TOPOFF timer INT pulse 1: Mask the TOPOFF timer INT pulse
0: Enable the CC_SNK and CC_SRC INT pulses 1: Mask the CC_SNK and CC_SRC INT pulse
column7: OTP-configurable.

column6: 0: Enable the BATT_LOW INT pulse 1: Mask the BATT_LOW INT pulse
0: Allow DEBUGACC and AUDIOACC INT pulse 1: Mask DEBUGACC and AUDIOACC INT pulse
